data.title: Domino Cipher (Decryption)
data.solution:
m = input()
k = '@'+input()[::-1]
for i in range(len(k)):m=m.replace(k[i],'#').replace('@',k[i]).replace('#','@')
print(m.replace('@',k[1]))
data.statement:
Decrypt an encrypted message, [[m]], given an encryption key, [[k]]. The original message was encrypted using Domino encryption, which goes through each letter {{k_i}} in [[k]], and replaces all occurrences of {{k_i}} in [[m]] with {{k_i+1}}. The last letter of [[k]] is replaced by the first letter of [[k]].

Note: Do not replace the newly decrypted letters, only replace the letters found in the original string.

[[k]] has no duplicate letters.
Not every letter of [[m]] is necessarily in [[k]].
Not every letter of [[k]] is necessarily in [[m]].

Uppercase and lowercase letters are not the same.

Example:

[[m]] = elooW rWdoH
[[k]] = HeloWrd

Using [[k]], the <<encryption>> would use the following conversion:

H -> e
e -> l
o -> W
W -> r
r -> d
d -> H

The answer should be: Hello World ( because using [[k]], Hello World would be encrypted to [[m]] = elooW rWdoH )
data.constraints:
[[k]] only contains uppercase and lowercase alphabetic characters
[[m]] is no longer than 1000 characters
[[k]] is no longer than 52 characters (i.e. 26 uppercase + 26 lowercase characters)
data.stubGenerator:
read m:string(100)
read n:string(52)
write answer

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Decrypt an encrypted message, m, given an encryption key, k. The original message was encrypted using Domino encryption, which goes through each letter k_i in k, and replaces all occurrences of k_i in m with k_i+1. The last letter of k is replaced by the first letter of k.

Note: Do not replace the newly decrypted letters, only replace the letters found in the original string.

k has no duplicate letters.
Not every letter of m is necessarily in k.
Not every letter of k is necessarily in m.

Uppercase and lowercase letters are not the same.

Example:

m = elooW rWdoH
k = HeloWrd

Using k, the encryption would use the following conversion:

H -> e
e -> l
o -> W
W -> r
r -> d
d -> H

The answer should be: Hello World ( because using k, Hello World would be encrypted to m = elooW rWdoH )
Input
Line 1: Encrypted message, m
Line 2: Encryption key, k
Output
Line 1: Decrypted message
Constraints
k only contains uppercase and lowercase alphabetic characters
m is no longer than 1000 characters
k is no longer than 52 characters (i.e. 26 uppercase + 26 lowercase characters)
Example
Input
dHrrW eWorl
dlroWeH
Output
Hello World
